Leveling used to be a hell of a lot harder though. Picked up the game again like a month ago and it's amazing how much faster you level up. Back when I started around launch time it took me months just to get to 22 even though I was a pretty active player. Now even with the exponential increase in exp requirements I've leveled up almost 10 lvls in a month. If it was back then I probably only would have leveled up 3 maybe 4 times in the same time frame.

Bro that pissed me off during the Deoxis raids last week. Some lvl 30 guy dropped out last second so it was just me and one other dude fighting the deoxis but both of us had a full teams of hard counters so we managed to get it to like 15% health before we ran out of time. If my team hadn't consisted mainly of pokemon 1500-2000 cp we probably would have beaten it with just 2 people but oh well. Didn't have many strong dark types at the time so I had to make do. At least I only wasted a free raid pass the other guy didnt seem to be as lucky

That really depends. You can get away with some pretty low cp pokemon if they're hard counters. I almost beat deoxis with 1 other player at lvl 35 with a team of dark types with an overall average of like 1800 cp. If they were in the 2200 range we probably would have beaten it but the point is compatibility is arguably more important than cp. After all a pokemon that deals 256% damage and only receives 24-39% will still fair better than a neutral pokemon with twice the cp dealing and receiving 100% damage.
Same bro. I didnt notice how bad I was getting till I found the scale and noticed I was pushing 190. Since then I downloaded pokemon go and lost about 15 in a month. It's a good motivator

Certain pokemon have a chance to be disguised as ditto. I think it changes but I'm pretty sure some of the disguises rn are weedle, gulping, and whismur. Honestly if you wanna catch a ditto your best bet is to catch every single pokemon you encounter

WRITING.TITLE: Why do some pokemon procc faster than others?
WRITING.TEXT: Just fought my little brother in pvp and we both used mamoswine with the same movesets but my brothers always used his charged move first. To see if it was a fluke we decided to try again but count the number of taps it takes and I found out it takes 7 taps for my mamoswine to procc while it only takes my little brother 6. Anyone know why?

I doubt it my mamoswine is 400-500 cp higher. Maybe it has to do the the IV's but I feel like with such a big cp difference it wouldnt matter. Afterall I was dealing a bit less than twice the damage to his mamoswine.
overall my brothers has better IV's but my attack stat is maxed out while his is 14/15 so my attack stat should still be higher than his either way.

WRITING.TITLE: Creselia raid 5 min looking for 10 people
WRITING.TEXT: 5 star raid 5 minutes from the time I post this. Looking for 10 people comment your username so we can fit as many people as possible. 9395 6433 0489 and 9498 1408 0855

Thata not it. Since creselia is fairly new people are flooding friend request inboxes. First day I hosted a raid and got 40 friend request in 5 minutes the yesterday it calmed down to about 20 request in 5 min but it's still a lot. Honestly the main thing that screws you over is what your name is and your timing. If you send a request first your request is getting pushed all the way to the bottom by the newer request and if your name starts with a z or something your name is gonna be towards the bottom when they go to send invites. It's all up to luck but when 20 other people are also vying for a spot your chances arent good. Just wait a couple days when everyones got their shines or 100 IVs there will be a lot less competition just dont wait too long or you wont be able to get enough people to do a raid at all

Besides it's all pretty fast paced I literally couldnt care less what level you are as long as you fill a spot 2 min isn't enough time to look up 10 peoples resumes especially when theres no way of knowing if they'll even show up or not

Yea creselia is deceptively hard to beat despite having a fairly low cp compared to other 5 star raid bosses it can take some punishment. Genesect could be done with like 2-3 people, heatran 3-4 but with creselia I wouldn't go lower than 6 people.

Honestly it depends. We remodeled the shit out of our house and it came out pretty nice. New carpet ,laminate floors, paint, counter tops, cabinets, toilets, light fixtures/ceiling fans, glass doors on the shower where the tub used to be as well as new tiles and decorative accents, stone tiles around the fireplace, etc. We also built the shed in our backyard, replaced the boiler around 2-3 years ago as well as the dead motor on our air conditioner. Overall I'd say we've saved tens of thousands of dollars by doing it ourselves with good results. If I can do it myself then I wont pay someone else to do it. Only things I won't fuck with are phone repairs cause they really make those things a bitch to fix yourself.

Jesus christ they overcharged the shit out of you for that. It's not even a hard fix to make either should take like 10 minutes to cut out the bad piece and then join and solder them together with a coupling. The cost of materials, tools and time alone (including the trip to the hardware store) probably wouldnt even cost half of what they charged you.

WRITING.TITLE: Anyone know how stunfisk is proccing so fast with earthquake in pvp?
WRITING.TEXT: The go hub says it should take 9 seconds for a galarian stunfisk with mudshot to charge an earth quake but it seems to be closer to 4.8 seconds seeing as how it proceed before my alolan marowak with hex and shadow ball . I almost thought it was an elite tm like hydro cannon cause it seems kinda broken. I always avoided those heavy charge moves like the plague cause they take forever but if you can actually get it to go off quickly then it'd be worthwhile to learn how.

Why do people care so much about random shinies? I mean I get it if it's a particularly cool looking one but I dont care if a random zigzagoon, sentret or patrat is shiny, I'll still send them to the shadow realm.

Make sure to avoid powering it up so it can be used in the great league. Since umbreon has a really high defense it has a lower cp limit since attack is weighted more highly when calculating a pokemon's final cp so basically it's like sneaking a high level pokemon into a lower level league. I dont know what umbreons ideal IVs are for pvp but since you seem new it probably doesnt matter all that much yet
If you want rare candies avoid the mega raids they seem like they're less likley to give candies and when they do it's only about 2. The regular 5 star bosses can give up to like 9
A select number of pokemon have a chance to be dittos so look it up and aim for those. Also note that if there is more than one of the same pokemon near eachother that one of them may be a ditto

Yea eventually you'll have more items than you know what to do with. These past few days I've probably dumped like 200 pokeballs to make room for more great and ultra balls for the upcoming community day

Just toss a bunch of them. They're incredibly common in pvp rewards. I only keep like 2 on me at a time. They can be used for a bunch of pokemon so dont get rid of them all especially if you got your eye on a specific pokemon but dont feel like you have to hold on to it. You'll wanna hold on to the other evolution items tho cause they're significantly less common especially unova stones but since they dont evolve nearly as many pokemon I just hold on to as many of them as the number of pokemon it can evolve.

Riolu just has a low hatch rate. It took me 13 attempts to hatch it from a 10k and it was only a 2 star. You just gotta keep grinding it, hatch as many trash eggs as possible then restock. Avoid opening gifts if you have an empty egg space. It was about 800k between my first attempt and finally getting riolu since 10k eggs dont spawn often either. The other 670k was spent getting rid of trash eggs.

Fast moves charge energy depending on how much damage they deal. High dps moves tend to charge energy slower and vice versa. Charge moves also have different amounts of energy they need before they can be used. Typically speaking the more energy it needs the more damage it deals though it also takes longer. Just look what a pokemon's best moveset is or look up the pokemon in the go hub for exact times

Pretty much, the nastier the move in terms of dps the longer it takes charge on it. Meanwhile on the opposite end of the spectrum there are moves that deal like zero damage like "lock on" which registeel can use but charges incredibly quickly. to keep it balanced though pokemon with lock on are pretty much limited to heavy moves like flash cannon, focus blast, etc.

If you're running charm you pretty much gotta commit to beating a pokemon to death with your fast move only cause you'll probably only get one shot off. That's why I typically start off with a fast proccing pokemon to take out their shields first. I think alolan raichu with volt switch and thunder punch is a good balance between a high dps and quick charge moves but people run a lot of dark types to be ready for it to get countered. A popular fast procc pokemon for the current season is obstagon with I think counter and nightslash since counter can deal with other dark types and steal types which are both fairly common rn meanwhile nightslash is good for chip damage or shield baiting.

Pigs arent really capable of compassion though. You ever seen how a momma pig treats her younglings. The runt dies off cause she refuses to feed it and the others she will literally throw or step on if they get in the way. Pretty sure that's the main reason the moms are caged while nursing in slaughter houses. Afterall you cant have your livestock dying before it matures.

Well I guess dogs tend to do the same with runts as well but they at least care enough about the rest of their pups to get depressed when they're taken away. Cows and pigs dont really care that much though. Well I guess cows can get attached to their calves after a while but wont mind if you take them away where as a dog would bite you.

WRITING.TEXT: Dont wanna let a good remote pass go to waste so I'd least like to get some rare candies or something out of it so I can claim the 3 free ones from the shop. I can solo most of the lower tier raids so you dont even need to join 9395 6433 0489
Yea but its quad weak and not nearly as tanky as cresselia. I just did a 6 person raid with one level 12 in there and we beat it with a little over half the time
Nah I'd rather raid just to farm rare candies so I don't have to walk 5 k just for a single candy. The raids have been giving a ton of healing items tho

Yea people are over exaggerating probably due to the trauma that was the creselia raids since that one was near impossible with less than 6 people but articuno has a quad weakness and is not nearly as tanky so its considerably easier to beat. Yesterday I beat it with 4 other level 30s and one level 12 with a little more than half the time left. If we consider the 12 as an invalid then you're right 5 people is more than enough. Even 4 people is enough and honestly I'd even say 3 level 30s is pushing it but with well built teams I think they should still be able to take it down with relative ease.

Depends on the boss. Articuno is quad weak and has a lower defense stat so 3 or 4 people should be relatively easy. Creselia despite having a significantly lower cp had a much higher defense stat and no quad weaknesses which is why that one would take at least 6 people. Just look up the recomended teams and party sizes for raid bosses on the silph road and itll tell you how easy it is. Articuno is rated as easy with 4 people with any combo of the top 12 counters powered up to level 25 so theoretically 4 level 25 players can easily beat articuno.
Yea I've been wanting to try it with my two younger brothers but one of them hasn't reached lvl 30 yet so I'm a bit hesitant
4 level 25s can beat articuno with relative ease. Just throwing that out there https://thesilphroad.com/raid-bosses

Its weird for them all to leave at the same time. Especially considering how many people there were chances are they were probably kicked before it started. It's happened to me before. Had a heatran raid I was hosting with my two younger brothers and someone I met on reddit. We had like 9 people in the raid but as soon as it started one of my brothers got kicked and so did the person I met through reddit as well as two others. Then towards the end of the raid I think the others were also kicked cause we almost beat the heatran but it was reduced to just my brother and me so we were barley unable to beat it. If I was by myself I would've been salty assuming everyone ditched me but since I was able to talk to my brothers and the person from reddit I found out it was a technical glitch.

Btw there are plenty of vaccines that save lives the reason you dont know about them is cause vaccines have nearly eradicated them entirely such as polio, smallpox, measles, etc. Polio alone killed or paralyzed around half a billion people world wide. And in case you really dont know what herd immunity is it's the decrease in likelyhood of a few unnvaccinated members of a populace to contract a disease from another since the majority of the populace is immune or resistant to it due to vaccinations which makes it harder for it to spread. Ever since the whole autism bs started measles which was thought to be eradicated was brought back due to the weakened herd immunity as more people refuse to get vaccinated.
Btw if you should look up what an iron lung is just to give you an idea of how bad some of these diseases are.
Yea we're lucky covid isn't that severe. If it was polio levels of lethal antimaskers/antivaxxers would shut up real quick

To whoever replied for some reason I can't find your comment but i read the first few words on my notifications so I got the gist of it, here you go. Herd immunity the resistance to the spread of a contagious disease within a population that results if a sufficiently high proportion of individuals are immune to the disease, especially through vaccination. Taken straight from the default google dictionary. On a side note herd immunity is meant to protect those with autoimmune disorders who cant take vaccines due to medical reasons. Not Karen's that believe everything they're told on Facebook

I feel you pvp gets pretty hard when you have to go up against people with nothing but legacy moves. I mean it's still possible to win if you're skilled enough with sack swapping, strategizing, and other things but you're at a severe disadvantage if you don't also have those moves. Honestly the introduction of those moves is pretty game breaking.

Have you not faced a legacy move user yet? Hydro cannon is basically surf on steroids. Not only does it charge faster it also deals more damage. Frenzy plant and blast burn are also pretty nasty. They take slightly longer than hydro cannon but they're basically the equivalent of overheat and solar beam the difference is blast burn doesnt have a debuff while frenzy plant deals less damage than solar beam but charges much faster. Other than those three the other nastiest legacy move is meteor mash on metagross. Deals the same damage as flash cannon but has almost the same charge time as psychic. Worst part is you cant really tank the hits cause they're all heavy hitting moves it doesnt matter if you single or quad resist it. It will chunk your health.

Theres also some fast tm legacy moves but the only one I can think of that actually hurts is dragon breath. Has a low damage but a really high dps so it'll quickly drain your health kinda like charm does. Similarly to charm though cause of it's high dps it also charges slowly though it does charge faster than charm but not by much.
